info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 13 at 5:28AM PDT until April 14 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 AM PDT THURSDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County including Mount Shasta City. This also includes portions oh Highway 80 including Snowmans Summit and Pondosa. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 11 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult during periods of heavier snow showers and at higher elevations. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute on Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are likely to be around 4000 feet Wednesday afternoon and then lower to near 3000 feet Thursday morning. The heaviest snowfall is likely to fall Wednesday night. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
